titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kevin Opstedal Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 04:02

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, notebooks, sketchbooks, audiovisual materials, printed materials, and other papers by or relating to poet Kevin Opstedal. It documents his work as a poet, as well as his research interest in the poets of Bolinas, California.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Granary Books, Inc. on the Ezra Pound Archive Fund and the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2011, 2012.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 5 (audiovisual materials): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Kevin Opstedal Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kevin Opstedal Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: YCAL MSS 632 and YCAL MSS 634

bioghist.head: Kevin Opstedal
bioghist.p: Kevin Opstedal is an American poet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, notebooks, sketchbooks, audiovisual materials, printed materials, and other papers by or relating to poet Kevin Opstedal. It documents his work as a poet, as well as his research interest in the poets of Bolinas, California.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two groupings: April 2011 Acquisition and May 2012 Acquisition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The April 2011 Acquisition consists of papers relating to poets in Bolinas, California, including corresondence, writings by Kevin Opstedal, writings by others, printed materials, and audiovisual materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Audiovisual materials, "Berkson / Kyger - 5/2/87", Box 2.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Audiovisual materials, "Tom Clark - 1-31-87", Box 2.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Audiovisual materials, "Joanne Kyger - 3/7/87", Box 2.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Audiovisual materials, "Lewis MacAdams - 12/23/86", Box 2.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

did.materialspec: The program was recorded at a low level. There is a high amount of hiss and background noise on the tape. The program is barely audible at times.
There is high background noise on the tape.
The program is distorted at times. There is a high amount of buzz and static on the tape.
The program was recorded at a very low level. There is a high amount of hiss and static on the tape. There is background noise on the tape. The program is barely audible at times.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The May 2012 Acquisition consists of correspondence, writings, notebooks, artwork, and other papers by or relating to Kevin Opstedal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains various writings and poems, including material used in Kevin Opstedal's 2007 book: User's Manual to the Pacific Coast Highway .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material relating to books by Kevin Opstedal, including a print-out of the cover of Like Rain , a poetry project newsletter from April / May 1998, print-out from litpress.com regarding Sand in the Vaseline , a print of the cover for Coastal Disturbance , and a proof of Variable High Cloudiness .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains three printing blocks relating to Kamikaze Blvd . (1985).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains art material related to Sunset Revisited , Like Rain and El Tsunami , as well as other books and projects. Also contained within is a portrait of Samuel Beckett by Kevin Opstedal.
